resources.string: Collection of useful text related functions which can be accessed within many apps inside the Android System by selecting a text within it. The supported options appear in the context menu that appears after selecting a text. You may have to reveal them by pressing the 3 dots icon in the context menu. The list of supported functions will keep on growing.
Easily text any unsaved number in WhatsApp. Useful if you want to text people for temporary purposes.
Evaluate mathematical expressions inline and replace the expression with its result. Works only on text selected that can be edited.

- In the below text field, type any phone number.
- Tap and hold on the phone number you just typed.
- Tap on the [T²] WhatsApp option. If the option is not visible, tap on the 3 dots to reveal it.
- If the phone number is available on WhatsApp (and if WhatsApp is installed) it should open the chat in WhatsApp.

- In the below text field, type any mathematical expression (for example, 1 + 2 + 3).
- Tap and hold on the expression you just typed.
- Tap on the [T²] Evaluate option. If the option is not visible, tap on the 3 dots to reveal it.
- If the mathematical expression typed was valid, you should see its result.
Great! You can do the same inside any app as long as you can select a text.
If it did not work, you can raise an issue in the Github repo. Would you like to do that now?
